poem:
Title: The Unbearable Lightness of Pastry

Thousand-layered folly and you,
thinking it's something beautiful.
Custard guts and pear breasts swimming 
in an ocean of hazelnuts - a fiction,
like the love letters never posted.
Just another bastard dessert, sugar spun,
one more French illusion.
Don't dust your heart with icing sugar,
it only caramelizes the pain.
Ah well,
drink up the wine instead,
life's too short 
for puff pastry pretensions.
